items.summary: Awarded to students who achieved a cumulative GPA above 3.65 in their undergraduate studies.
items.title: Magna Cum Laude

items.summary: Specialty: Compiler Design & Programming Language Theory
Electives: Compilers, Computer Graphics, Computer Security, Machine Learning
Electives: Abstract Algebra, Chaos Theory, Real Analysis, Statistics

objective.body: I am interested in compiler engineer roles or roles involving the design and implementation of compilers. I have industry experience as both a software developer and a compiler engineer as well as leadership experience as a tutor and mentor for engineering students.
objective.heading: Objective

profile.subtitle: Computer Science Graduate Student at UWM

items.summary: I built my personal website using JavaScript (with JQuery) and Bootstrap and it contains links to various professional social media as well as my resume. It is hosted on an instance of Microsoft Azure's Static Web App.
items.title: Personal Website

items.summary: I enjoy playing around with public APIs, but creating typed models for responses can be a hassle. To solve this issue, I created a program built on ANTLR to parse JSON output and generate a C# class file containing model definitions for the API response. All that is required for the program is a URL to the endpoint and it outputs the C# model.
items.title: ModelGen

items.summary: I utilized NASA's public Astronomy Photograph of the Day (APOD) API to write a program for both Windows and OS X to change the user's desktop background on a daily basis. I also used the same API to create a Discord bot that displays information about the current photograph of the day.
items.title: NASA APOD Projects

items.summary: As a compiler engineer at Astronautics, I am responsible for the design and implementation of a domain specific language that compiles to a proprietary instruction set. I built the compiler from the ground up and I implement algorithms for all phases of the compiler (lexer, parser, analyzer, generator) including writing test cases using a hand-build test suite to validate compiler correctness.

As a software development intern at CaraFlow, I was responsible for writing software in a variety of projects. I implemented features and bug fixes for legacy software that runs in over half of hospitals nationwide. I wrote drivers and implemented REST APIs to allow e-paper devices to update their displays wirelessly. I was tasked with architecting and managing the cloud services architecture for multiple projects using Microsoft Azure.

As a tutor for the College of Engineering and Applied Science at UWM, I worked with students to help them further their understanding in Computer Science, Mathematics, and Physics courses. Classes that I tutored include Algorithms, Calculus, Data Structures, Discrete Mathematics, Programming Languages, Statistics, and Theory of Computation.
